result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy J. Bailey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy J. Bailey was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample

Count 1 - Dismissed

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J. Bailey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy J. Bailey in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 2:58 pm  State moves to dismiss ct 1 without prejudice.  Plea to ct 2, probation.  Atty Grubofski agrees and def agrees to plea agreement as stated.  Plea questionnaire form filed and reviewed with def.  Ct 2 - Guilty plea entered.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Elements reviewed.  Court finds def understand charge, penalties and rights.  Factual basis.  Court will accept plea, found guilty.  Court will dismiss ct 1 without prejudice.  Statement by DA for sentencing.  Sentencing arguments by Atty Grubofski.  Brief statement by def.  Court will accept plea agreement.  Sentence withheld, probation 1 yr.  Counseling as required.  Cost ordered with DNA surcharge.  DNA sample    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Bond to be applied and any balance to poster.  No credit.  Post conviction rights

Defendant Timothy J. Bailey in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:40 pm. Atty Schuster has copy of complaint, waives reading, advised of penalties, no contact has been lifted to no violence contact with victim & waives time limits.  Def. agrees to waive time limits.  Court will reserve def's right to p.h. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy J. Bailey not in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:09 a.m. State advises victim has requested bond no contact condition be lifted. Victim has provided verification of safety plan. State moves to modify bond. Court modifies bond condition to No violent contact with victim J.Z. COC to send copy of minutes to Sheriff's Dept.
